[[Image:Love heart uidaodjsdsew.gif|200px|thumb|right|A [[cartoonish]] version of the [[Heart (symbol)|heart]], a frequent modern symbol of love. It is used very ofthen in valentines cards.]]
 
'''Love''' has several different meanings in the [[English (language)|English]] language, from something that gives a little pleasure ("I loved that meal") to something for which one would die ([[patriotism]], [[pair-bonding]]). It can describe an intense feeling of [[affection]], an [[emotion]] or an emotional state. In ordinary use, it usually refers to interpersonal love. And what is usually felt by a person for another person, and is usually impossible to describe. Dictionaries tend to define ''love'' as deep affection or fondness.<ref>''Oxford Illustrated American Dictionary'' (1998) + ''Merriam-Webster Collegiate Dictionary'' (2000).</ref> In colloquial use, according to polled opinion, the most favored definitions of ''love'' include the words:<ref>[http://www.humanthermodynamics.com/RP2-Love.html '04 Poll of 250 Chicagoans] – Institute of Human Thermodynamics (Chicago)</ref>
 
'''Love''' has several different meanings in the [[English (language)|English]] language, from something that gives a little pleasure ("I loved that meal") to something for which one would die ([[patriotism]], [[pair-bonding]]). It can describe an intense feeling of [[affection]], an [[emotion]] or an emotional state. In ordinary use, it usually refers to interpersonal love. And what is usually felt by a person for another person, and is usually impossible to describe. Dictionaries tend to define ''love'' as deep affection or fondness.<ref>''Oxford Illustrated American Dictionary'' (1998) + ''Merriam-Webster Collegiate Dictionary'' (2000).</ref> In colloquial use, according to polled opinion, the most favored definitions of ''love'' include the words:<ref>[http://www.humanthermodynamics.com/RP2-Love.html '04 Poll of 250 Chicagoans] – Institute of Human Thermodynamics (Chicago)</ref>
     
#'''[[life]]''' - someone or something for which you would give your life.
 
#'''[[life]]''' - someone or something for which you would give your life.
−
#'''[[care]]''' - someone or something about which you care more than yourself.
+
#'''[[care]]''' - someone or something about which you care more, than even yourself.
 
#'''[[friendship]]''' - favored interpersonal associations or relationships.
 
#'''[[friendship]]''' - favored interpersonal associations or relationships.
−
#'''[[human bonding|union]]''' - a synergistic connection, as in the perfect union of two souls.
+
#'''[[human bonding|union]]''' - a synergistic connection, as in the perfect union of two souls bonded together.
−
#'''[[family]]''' - people related via common ancestry, religion, or race, etc.
+
#'''[[family]]''' - people related via common ancestry, religion, or race, etc. Mainly ran around your family tree.
     
The concept of love, however, is subject to debate. Some deny the existence of love, calling it a recently invented abstraction. Moreover, approximately 13 percent of cultures reportedly have no word for love.<ref>{{cite book | author=Ackerman, Diane | title=A Natural History of Love | publisher=Vintage Books | year=1994 | id=ISBN 0679761837}}</ref> Others maintain that love exists but is undefinable; being a quantity which is [[spiritual]], [[metaphysical]], or [[philosophical]] in nature, etc. Perhaps due to its emotional primacy, love is one of the most common themes in art.
 
The concept of love, however, is subject to debate. Some deny the existence of love, calling it a recently invented abstraction. Moreover, approximately 13 percent of cultures reportedly have no word for love.<ref>{{cite book | author=Ackerman, Diane | title=A Natural History of Love | publisher=Vintage Books | year=1994 | id=ISBN 0679761837}}</ref> Others maintain that love exists but is undefinable; being a quantity which is [[spiritual]], [[metaphysical]], or [[philosophical]] in nature, etc. Perhaps due to its emotional primacy, love is one of the most common themes in art.
